Content: Reset all global LeaderLib settings. EXPERIMENTAL!

If enabled, all items will have a "World Tooltip", showing the item's name when world tooltips are enabled (ALT by default for keyboard + mouse, or clicking the Right Stick for controllers).
Disabling this may require a save/load to get items to reset.
Certain mod books will be automatically added to your inventory initially, if enabled.
If enabled, items will be automatically identified.
When combat starts, LeaderLib will autosave the game.
Enable timed autosaving, using the interval and preferences set.
In multiplayer, your inventory will be unlocked after an initial delay.
If enabled, beneficial statuses applied by skills outside of combat will be permanent until you enter combat. Some status types are ignored, like invisible and healing statuses.
Enable various debug features with LeaderLib. Not recommended.
Dialog redirection will be restricted to characters you own as a user. For instance, if disabled, and another player in multiplayer has the highest persuasion, they may get dialog redirected to them.
Redirect to Character with Highest Persuasion
Dialog will be redirected to the character with the highest persuasion amount, instead of only avatar characters.
Enable redirecting automatically started dialog to characters that match your preferences, such as an avatar or character with the highest persuasion.
Timed autosaving will pause while in combat.
Enables friendly fire, which can allow skills or other mod mechanics to target allies.
If enabled, [Key:Shout_SpiritVision_DisplayName:Spirit Vision] will turn into a toggle, allowing you to enable or disable [Handle:h81ca2748g7469g47c9g8e5dg49ecc8d1e382:Spirit Vision] at will.
When entering combat, party members within the set radius will automatically join that combat.
Characters that follow you with Chain All will no longer avoid surfaces.

If enabled, consumable items such as drinks, food, potions, and ingredients will show their effects without needing to consume it first.
The [Key:LeaderLib_UI_GameSettings_Client_HideConsumableEffects:Show Consumable Effects] setting can be disabled in the Gameplay tab to still hide these effects for yourself, while allowing it globally here.
Note: This works without any permanent stat overrides, so it's safe to enable/disable at will.
Fixes the Unhealable status to actually make it prevent healing. This is a status already in the game that mods may use.
If "Pull Party Into Combat" is enabled, this is the minimum radius party members must be from that combat to automatically join. Default: 30m
The time delay between autosaving, in minutes.

Set the base carry weight value. If -1, this option will be disabled.
Default: 0
Carry Weight Formula:[Special:CarryWeightFormula]

This is a multiplier the game uses to determine if a character should exit combat, due to not seeing any enemies. Setting this value higher will keep you in combat, despite being far away from any enemies.
Default: 2.5
Formula: ((Value * Value) * character.Sight) * character.Sight
